item.title: Excerpts from 2018 reading
item.description: Take me to the first quote from: Ulysses by James Joyce, Iran: Empire of the Mind by Michael Axworthy, Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind by Yuval Noah Harari, SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome by Mary Beard May ðŸ”— Already, in those two books, Joyce had made a central theme of a perennial problem â€“ that those who know how to feel often have no capacity to express themselves, and, by the time they have acquired the expressive capacity, they have all but forgotten how to feel.
